Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora; exterior: animal motif consisting of springing goat (forelegs, back, belly, and neck remaining) to left; cable pattern as filling ornament; below, wide black band above tips of rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.002)
